TestCase.Title: Test case EID_CLIENT_E_04_T
TestCase.Purpose: This test case checks the behavior of the eID-Client in case the TC Token Provider offers a TLS server certificate based on domain parameters not conforming to [TR-03124-1].
TestCase.Precondition: A single basic card reader is connected to the eID-Client system.
A single active eID-Card is connected to the card reader.

TestStep.Description: [TC_TOKEN_URL] is a valid https-URL where the TC Token can be retrieved by the eID-Client.

ExpectedResult.Text: The eID-Client is activated and starts establishment of channel TLS-1-2 to the TC Token Provider.

Command.Text: The TC Token Provider accepts the connection TLS-1-2.

TestStep.Description: The TC Token Provider supports cipher suites listed for TLS-1-2 in the ICS of the eID-Client.
The TC Token Provider only offers the TLS server certificate with a key length not conforming to the [TR-03124-1] during the initial handshake.

According to the testing parameters and cipher suite, the TC Token Provider uses either TLS server certificate [CERT_TLS_ESERVICE_3_B], [CERT_TLS_ESERVICE_3_C] or [CERT_TLS_ESERVICE_3_O] from [CERT_SET_3] with a key length not conform to [TR-03124-1].

ExpectedResult.Text: The TLS-1-2 channel is not established.
The connection establishment is aborted by the eID-Client.
The eID-Client returns an error "Not Found" to the browser. In case of a web server based Client-Interface, the HTTP error code is "404 Not Found".
